p: Hemp is typically a dioecious, obligate cross-pollinated species with a diploid genome (2 n = 20), although monoecious types have been bred. It is genetically complex and therefore has significant variability in phenotype and sex expression [ 11, 12]. Also, research has shown significant intra- and inter-cultivar karyotype variation among eight monoecious and two dioecious cultivars [ 13]. Plants may be entirely female, entirely male, or a gradient of intermediate [ 14].
